full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Tender Information

* **Title (English)**: Analytical Services for Rare Earth Element Samples
* **Title (French)**: Services d'analyse d'échantillons contenant des éléments des terres rares
* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01004516
* **Amendment Number**: 2
* **Solicitation Number**: NRCan- 5000067930
* **Publication Date**: 2022-08-17
* **Tender Closing Date and Time**: 2022-09-28T14:00:00

## Tender Details

* **Type of Tender**: Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Method of Tendering**: Competitive, Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements**: Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Atlantic Procurement Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* **Location of Work**: National Capital Region (NCR)
* **Region of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)

## Tender Description

The tender is for the provision of quantitative chemical analysis services to support ongoing research studies at CanmetMINING.

## Tender Notice

The tender notice, documentation, and attachments are available at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents).

## Contact Information

For more information regarding this tender notice, please contact:

* Harlow, Brenda
* Address: 580 Booth Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E4
* Email: [Brenda.Harlow@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca](mailto:Brenda.Harlow@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)

Please note that the tender has expired. However, the information remains active for reference purposes. This tender notice is for guidance and convenience only. Conced cannot ensure accuracy or completeness of this information, and all information must be verified by the user.  Any information that is medical beyond the scope of this notice or the provided documents must not be considered as legally binding.  Contact a certified lawyer or bidder representative to help navigate the processes.  Make sure to verify all information with the official sources.
